data.meta_description: Choose OPmobility and invent the clean mobility of tomorrow
data.text:
Join us!

Let’s invent the future of mobility – together

Discover our International Finance Graduate Program

Skills for the clean, connected car

The automotive industry is witnessing unprecedented changes, compelling manufacturers and suppliers to speed up their transition to new forms of mobility. Joining OPmobility is an opportunity to take your place at the heart of this transformation and engage with the exciting challenges of the clean, connected mobility of the future. From mechatronics to plastronics, electrochemicals to software engineering, data analysis and more, you’ll find your own path through a wealth of opportunities. Are you ready to live the adventure?

OPmobility is hiring!

JOB FAMILY

COUNTRY

CONTRACT

Reasons to join us

Live your passion

for innovation

Live your passion

for innovation

Innovation means inventing the future alongside our customers, with passion, daring and vision. Join our teams and play your part in the technological adventure to create the clean, connected car of the future.

Find out more

Take on the challenges

and develop your potential

Take on the challenges

and develop your potential

Projects with our teams, empowering you through training programs, OPmobility offers an environment that enables each individual to develop their skills and advance their career. Management, career switching, international experience: in joining OPmobility, you gain access to a host of opportunities in our 25 countries.

Be part of an ethical,

responsible company

Be part of an ethical,

responsible company

Sustainable mobility is at the heart of what we do: be part of changing the automotive world by joining a company that respects the environment. Lighter and more aerodynamic vehicles, energy storage, emission reduction, fuel cell stacks, hydrogen: playing your part in these changes, you’ll contribute directly to reducing environmental impacts.

Find out more

Our job families

Research

& Innovation

Research & Innovation

This is where the major projects of the future take shape! Find the ideas that will shape the car of tomorrow. Create products at the cutting edge of technology: aerodynamics, built-in sensors, weight reduction, lower CO2 emissions, etc.

Apply here to be a design engineer, designer, software developer, patent engineer, innovation data analyst, etc.

Engineering &

Development

Engineering & Development

Progressing from the call for tender to a prototype, the design phase is when you’ll shape the final product, from process modeling to industrial toolmaking, via simulations and technical trials. Your objective: to ensure that the project’s reliability, performance and cost leave the customer satisfied!

Apply to be a program manager, product engineer, validation engineer, buyer, quality manager, sales manager, etc.

Industrial &

Production

Industrial & Production

Progressing from the prototype to mass production. You will plan and optimize the manufacture of products in our production facilities. Procure and manage machinery, purchase raw materials, manufacture and deliver products, and manage industrial performance.

Apply to be an industrial engineer, continuous improvement engineer, buyer, quality manager, logistics manager, production facility manager, etc.

Support

functions

Support functions

Vital to the company’s success, you’ll enable our operations teams to increase their effectiveness. Manage financial performance, recruit the right talent, consolidate accounts, design tools for digital collaboration, ensure compliance with safety legislation, grow the company’s reputation, etc. All these functions help OPmobility to run smoothly and maintain its enviable reputation.

Text transcription

My name's Dave Hill, I'm the Research Director for the Tanktronic Project.

I started my career at Plastic Omnium as a co-op student through Kettering University in 1998. It's a program where you're working 50% of the time and going to school 50% of the time.

Throughout most of my career, I've worked in the research group at Plastic Omnium. A few years back, I took over as Research Manager in Troy. Now, I'm based in Brussels working on directing a project for the fuel system of tomorrow.

I would say the thing I'm most proud of at Plastic Omnium is: working here and making the transition from a purely mechanical world to a world of mechatronics, and that's best exemplified probably through the project of the E-Valve, where we've come up with a mechatronic component. So you have to bridge this world from programming all the way down to the basic physics of the component.

I think two things motivate me here at Plastic Omnium, the first is the people. It's a very collaborative and open environment, which allows us to succeed and do things quickly. The second is really the prestige of the company, It's not easy for a company to survive for 70 years, and still maintain growth.

And so I'm very proud to work here. I think honestly what it takes to succeed at Plastic Omnium is open communication and honesty. It's what our culture is built around, and it's what makes you thrive in this company.

Text transcription

Good morning, my name is Zhezhe Zhang. I am a Validation Engineer at Sigmatech Engineering Center.

My job is to ensure that the customer requirements are met during the development phase, in order to guarantee the quality of our products during the complete lifecycle of the vehicle.

On a daily basis, this entails the analysis of customer specifications and associated testing methodologies, the creation of internal tests according to specific needs, the follow-up of the validation plan, the technical contribution to the development of the product and process, to ensure their conformity, together with the Project Team, and finally the writing and validation of testing reports.

My job as a Validation Engineer allows me to work with colleagues from different departments like the Project, Simulation and Prototyping Teams. I work with different Engineering Centers worldwide: Munich, Pappenheim, Bratislava, Greer…

I am particularly proud to have participated in the integration of a new Shaker test facility at the Sigmatech Laboratory.

I came to France in 2013 to finish my double degree in Mechanical Engineering. I was lucky enough to find my first job and to join the Plastic Omnium family.

Hello, my name is Carmen Hoffendahl and I am a Know-How Material Engineer at Plastic Omnium based in Σ-Sigmatech in Lyon.

The main task as a Material Engineer within PO is the choice of the raw materials for each client and product line, that can be for example: a bumper, a tailgate, a structural part or a body panel part.

Since I have been at in Plastic Omnium, the biggest challenge that I’ve had was the integration of Faurecia Automotive Exteriors and the welcome of our new colleagues. Especially, the deployment of our standards within the new perimeter and helping our new colleagues to experience the “PO Way”.

What motivates me to come to work each day at Plastic Omnium is that each day is different. Each day you have different challenges and a typical day is not predictable. Each day, you come and you see what the day is giving.

Text transcription

I am Monica Pita, Plant Manager at Plastic Omnium in Vigo.

I started my career in Plastic Omnium as an intern. I had worked as an intern for a year and then as a Production Manager for ten years.

Then I was in charge of Manufacturing Management. For one year now, I've been Plant Manager in the Auto Inergy Division.

I'm very proud of the opportunity the company has given me to develop myself, to learn and to thrive. I'm also proud of the team I lead and all support I have from each of them.

I've been working with them for six years now as part of the team.

Now I lead them and they made the transition easier. I am very well supported. I really enjoy working for this company because we work for production, really close to the customer. There is a huge team working for innovation and to assure our future for the next years.

In order to succeed in Plastic Omnium it takes energy, enthusiasm, teamwork engagement, being combative...

And pushing yourself day by day with plenty of energy and enthusiasm.

Text transcription

Hello, I am Teresa Vazquez. I am in charge of Purchasing at the Plastic Omnium plant in Redondela, Spain.

My main missions are to make sure that the plant’s needs are fully covered at the best conditions in terms of quality and service. This contributes to the plant's profitability.

I believe that the key to success in a job such as mine is the willingness to learn and good negotiation skills. Add to this an eagerness to excel, and perseverance to meet your targets.

I believe that my biggest achievement at Plastic Omnium has been to create, at the Redondela plant, a Purchasing culture. The employees have become aware of the importance of negotiating with suppliers and seeking out new products, new alternatives, helping the factory to keep growing and developing sustainably on the long term.

Text transcription

My name is Jessica Blair. I'm the Plant Controller here at Chattanooga USA for Plastic Omnium.

I joined Plastic Omnium just after graduating with my MBA to become the US Commercial Controller.

I held various positions in Finance before transitioning into the Logistics Department as the US Systems Controller, but I missed Finance so I was grateful when I was given the opportunity to move back into the Finance team as Plant Controller here at Chattanooga.

Last year, we received some substantial cost savings targets from upper Management, and by coordinating with the local team here, including the Buyer, the Cost Center Managers and the Director, we were able to not only accomplish this target, but also to exceed it, which made everybody here really proud of our accomplishment.

I enjoy the variety of challenges you face here at Plastic Omnium and the camaraderie you feel with the other team members when you work together to accomplish your goals.

Based on my experience, to succeed at Plastic Omnium, you need to be flexible. You're always facing new challenges, and you need to be able to learn from them, and draw on your past experiences in order to face new obstacles that you haven't encountered before.

Text transcription

Hello, I'm Sandrine Lepesqueux, I'm a Marketing Analyst for Plastic Omnium in Troy, USA.

I started 5 years ago with Plastic Omnium. I was Marketing Analyst in the South-East of France.

My main mission at that time was to support the Sales & Marketing team by doing analysis of the Chinese and European markets.

In 2014, I joined the Marketing team in Paris. I was also part of the project team of our Market Intelligence Tool, and in September 2016, I got the opportunity to move to Troy in the US.

Here, I'm very proud to support the growth of the company in the region. I'm very proud of my participation with PO at the Raid Centrale Supélec in 2016. It was an amazing experience, very challenging. My team was a mix of cultures and profiles. We got along very well, we were able to build a strong relationship, and thanks to the trust and support we gave to each other, we were able to finish 7th out of 45 teams.

In my work at Plastic Omnium, I like the people the most. I've got the opportunity to meet great people, great talents within the organization, and then, the opportunities to travel and evolve, changing position.

To finish, I would say I enjoy my position as Marketing Analyst: you've got the opportunity to bring data analytics to the forefront of the strategic planning, and this is very exciting.

To succeed at Plastic Omnium, according to me, you need to be dedicated, ambitious and mobile.

Text transcription

Hello I’m Claire d'Achon. I'm an Industrial Designer at Plastic Omnium, part of the Intelligent Exterior Systems Division.

As a designer today, I work with OEMs (carmakers) and make the link between the Style department and the Engineering department at Plastic Omnium.

We also work on a large range of products such as bumpers, tailgates, door modules and other body panels.

Everything is linked with different features: aerodynamics, new technology integration, lighting functions.

And so the daily work is to go with the OEMs and bring our support by making some sketching, some renderings, some style concepts, and to show them what it would look like if we integrate our new technologies into their style features.

I've been a designer for 10 years and I studied Product Design. I started my career by managing the design at Heuliez Bus in transportation design.

I have 2 passions in life: first, horses. I love riding, I love competition.

And I have another passion for cars, vintage cars. When I was 22 years old, I bought a vintage car that I restored, and now I drive it and have a lot of fun!

I think as a Designer, it's very important to love your product. When you receive a brief, you start drawing it and develop the ideas with many other people. The day it comes out, either as a mock-up or production part, it's amazing to see it at scale 1, to see the finishing, to see the proportions.

And of course, it's all a question of emotion, feeling, intuition.

In my opinion a Designer has a major responsibility in shaping the connected and sustainable vehicle of the future.

Students and recent graduates

As a student or recent graduate, you’ll find your role at OPmobility thanks to the variety on offer. With internships, work-study programs and VIE vacancies in IT, procurement, production, research and innovation, finance, logistics and more – all professions are possible.

INTERNSHIPS AND WORK-STUDY

PROGRAMS WITH OPmobility

Whether you hail from an engineering school, business school or university, you’ll find numerous opportunities with OPmobility.

The opening weeks are dedicated to orientation and training, after which you’ll move quickly onto projects that will involve you in real challenges with considerable independence. All our interns say that a course with PO is a unique opportunity to learn and develop greater responsibility.

We recruit 600 interns and 300 work-study trainees worldwide every year.

VIE: BUILD YOUR

INTERNATIONAL EXPERIENCE

VIE is a unique opportunity to acquire experience as you take the first steps in your international career. Supported by the French government, this program enables young Europeans aged 18 to 28 to work outside their home country for between 6 and 24 months.

We welcome more than 100 VIE candidates in all types of jobs every year, mostly in Germany, USA, UK, Slovakia and Belgium. Are you interested in an international career? VIE is an excellent way to start your journey!
